episodeTitle: The Legend Has Begun! Head to the Grand Line
episodeTitleJapanese: 伝説は始まった！目指せ偉大なる航路（グランドライン）
episodeTitleRomanized: Densetsu wa Hajimatta! Mezase Gurando Rain
description: The Straw Hats make their dramatic escape from Loguetown after a mysterious intervention saves them from Smoker. As a storm rages and lightning strikes, the crew boards the Going Merry and sets sail toward the Grand Line, each member declaring their dreams.

events.title: Zoro vs Tashigi - Swords Clash
events.description: Tashigi confronts Zoro about his legendary Wado Ichimonji sword and challenges him to a duel. Zoro reluctantly engages, troubled by her resemblance to his deceased friend Kuina.
events.significance: This battle highlights Zoro's internal conflict regarding Tashigi's striking resemblance to Kuina, establishing a recurring dynamic between these characters that will continue throughout the series.

quotes.text: You won't fight me seriously because I'm a woman!
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi expressing frustration at Zoro's reluctance to fight her seriously

events.title: Kuina Flashback During Battle
events.description: As Zoro fights Tashigi, he experiences flashbacks to his childhood friend Kuina, highlighting how Tashigi's appearance and words remind him of her.
events.significance: Reinforces Zoro's emotional connection to his past and his promise to Kuina, explaining his discomfort when fighting Tashigi.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Tashigi
events.description: Zoro quickly defeats Tashigi in their sword duel and continues rushing toward the ship, leaving her frustrated on the ground.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's superior swordsmanship while establishing the ongoing rivalry between him and Tashigi that will develop throughout the series.

events.title: Smoker Uses White Out Technique
events.description: Smoker demonstrates his Moku Moku no Mi powers by using White Out to trap Buggy, Alvida, and their crews in thick smoke, easily capturing them all.
events.significance: Showcases Smoker's formidable Devil Fruit abilities and establishes him as a powerful Marine capable of easily defeating multiple pirate crews simultaneously.

events.title: Luffy vs Smoker Confrontation
events.description: Smoker catches up to Luffy and challenges him, stating that if Luffy can defeat him, he can proceed to the Grand Line. The two engage in a fierce battle.
events.significance: This is the first major confrontation between Luffy and Smoker, establishing their rivalry that will continue throughout the series. It also demonstrates the power gap between a rookie pirate and an experienced Logia user.

quotes.text: If you can beat me, you can go to the Grand Line!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker challenging Luffy before their battle

events.title: Smoker's White Blow Attack
events.description: Smoker uses his White Blow technique against Luffy, turning his arm into smoke and launching his fist as a long-range punch that overwhelms Luffy.
events.significance: Demonstrates another application of Smoker's Moku Moku no Mi abilities and shows Luffy's difficulty in fighting a Logia-type Devil Fruit user.

events.title: Monkey D. Dragon Intervenes
events.description: Just as Smoker is about to capture Luffy, a mysterious cloaked figure appears and physically stops Smoker by grabbing his weapon, preventing him from finishing Luffy.
events.significance: This is Dragon's first active intervention in the series, marking a pivotal moment. Though his identity as Luffy's father isn't revealed yet, his appearance saves the protagonist and allows the story to continue. This moment becomes one of the most significant mysterious events in the early series.

quotes.text: There is no reason to stop a man from setting out to sea.
quotes.speaker: Dragon
quotes.context: Dragon's cryptic statement to Smoker about not interfering with Luffy's destiny

events.title: Dragon's Cryptic Warning About Destiny
events.description: Dragon tells Smoker that there is no reason to stop a man's destiny, hinting at Luffy's greater purpose and potentially foreshadowing his future as a major figure in the world.
events.significance: This statement from Dragon suggests he has knowledge of Luffy's potential destiny and importance to the world, adding layers of mystery and prophecy to Luffy's journey toward becoming Pirate King.

quotes.text: There is no reason to stop a man from setting out to sea.
quotes.speaker: Dragon
quotes.context: Dragon's statement about fate and destiny

events.title: Mysterious Storm Arrives at Loguetown
events.description: A sudden and unnatural storm descends upon Loguetown with incredible speed. Nami notes the atmospheric pressure is dropping dramatically, indicating a massive storm approaching impossibly fast.
events.significance: The timing and unnatural nature of this storm, arriving precisely when Luffy needs to escape, raises questions about Dragon's potential weather-controlling abilities and adds to the mystery surrounding his powers.

quotes.text: The atmospheric pressure is dropping so fast! A massive storm is coming!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami detecting the sudden weather change

events.title: Green Wind Phenomenon
events.description: An unnatural green gust of wind sweeps through Loguetown, helping Buggy and Alvida escape from Smoker's capture and assisting the Straw Hats in their escape.
events.significance: This mysterious green wind appears to be connected to Dragon's presence and powers, suggesting he may have Devil Fruit abilities related to wind or weather manipulation. This becomes a significant clue to Dragon's powers that fans theorize about for years.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Rocket to Board Ship
events.description: Luffy stretches his arms to grab onto the Going Merry and uses Gomu Gomu no Rocket to propel himself and his crewmates (Zoro, Sanji, and Usopp) onto the ship in one swift motion.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's creative use of his Devil Fruit powers for quick escapes and shows his ability to carry multiple people using his stretching abilities.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy propelling himself and his crew to the ship

events.title: Straw Hats Escape Loguetown
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully escape Loguetown aboard the Going Merry as the storm rages, leaving behind Smoker, Tashigi, and the other Marines.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Loguetown Arc and the Straw Hats' final moments in the East Blue before entering the Grand Line, a pivotal transition point in the series.

events.title: Smoker Decides to Pursue into the Grand Line
events.description: Despite Tashigi's concerns, Smoker makes the decision to pursue the Straw Hats into the Grand Line, determined not to let them escape.
events.significance: Establishes Smoker as a recurring antagonist who will chase the Straw Hats beyond the East Blue, setting up future confrontations in the Grand Line.

events.title: Buggy and Alvida Form Alliance to Enter Grand Line
events.description: Buggy and Alvida, having escaped from Smoker's capture, decide to form an alliance and follow the Straw Hats into the Grand Line to get revenge.
events.significance: Establishes the Buggy and Alvida Alliance, creating recurring antagonists who will appear later in the series.

events.title: Grand Line Vow Ceremony
events.description: As the Straw Hats approach the Grand Line, each crew member places their foot on a barrel and declares their individual dream: Luffy to become Pirate King, Zoro to become the world's greatest swordsman, Nami to draw a map of the world, Usopp to become a brave warrior of the sea, and Sanji to find the All Blue.
events.significance: This iconic scene solidifies the crew's bonds and individual motivations as they enter the Grand Line. It's one of the most memorable and emotional moments in early One Piece, representing the crew's unity despite their different goals.

quotes.text: I'm going to be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration during the vow ceremony

quotes.text: I'm going to be the world's greatest swordsman!
quotes.speaker: Zoro

quotes.text: I'm going to draw a map of the world!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: I'm going to be a brave warrior of the sea!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

quotes.text: I'm going to find the All Blue!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

events.title: Approaching the Grand Line
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully navigate toward the entrance to the Grand Line, marking the end of their East Blue journey and the beginning of their Grand Line adventure.
events.significance: Represents a major milestone in the series - the transition from the relatively safe East Blue to the dangerous and legendary Grand Line where the real adventure begins.

events.title: Discovery of Apis in the Water
events.description: At the end of the episode, the Straw Hats spot what appears to be birds circling in the ocean, but upon closer inspection, they discover it's actually a young girl floating in the water.
events.significance: This sets up the next arc (Warship Island Arc, anime-only filler) and introduces the character Apis, creating a cliffhanger for the next episode.

quotes.text: There is no reason to stop a man from setting out to sea.
quotes.speaker: Dragon

quotes.text: I'm going to be King of the Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: I'm going to be the world's greatest swordsman!
quotes.speaker: Zoro

quotes.text: I'm going to draw a map of the world!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: I'm going to be a brave warrior of the sea!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

quotes.text: I'm going to find the All Blue!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

themes.description: The episode emphasizes each character's individual dreams during the iconic vow ceremony, while Dragon's cryptic words about destiny suggest Luffy has a greater role to play in the world.
themes.symbolism: The barrel ceremony symbolizes the crew's unity and commitment to supporting each other's dreams as they enter the most dangerous sea in the world.

themes.description: Dragon's mysterious intervention and the timely storm raise questions about fate, destiny, and whether some events are meant to happen regardless of obstacles.
themes.symbolism: The green wind and sudden storm represent unseen forces working to ensure Luffy's journey continues, hinting at his importance to the world.

themes.description: The episode marks the end of the East Blue Saga and the beginning of the Grand Line adventure, representing a major transition point in the series.
themes.symbolism: Leaving Loguetown, where Gold Roger was born and executed, symbolizes Luffy following in the Pirate King's footsteps toward the Grand Line.
culturalReferences: References to Gold Roger's legacy and the beginning of the Great Pirate Era

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist fighting to escape and reach his dream
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his determination to reach the Grand Line despite powerful opposition, and reaffirms his dream during the vow ceremony.
keyActions: Uses Gomu Gomu no Rocket to board the ship with his crew
Declares his dream to become Pirate King during the vow ceremony
quotes: I'm going to be King of the Pirates!

characterSpotlights.development: Dragon makes his first major intervention, saving Luffy from Smoker and making cryptic statements about destiny, establishing his role as a mysterious figure watching over Luffy's journey.
keyActions: Physically stops Smoker from capturing Luffy
Makes cryptic statement about not stopping a man's destiny
Possibly causes or influences the storm and green wind
quotes: There is no reason to stop a man from setting out to sea.

characterSpotlights.development: Smoker is established as a formidable opponent and a Marine who won't give up on justice, deciding to pursue the Straw Hats into the Grand Line.
keyActions: Easily captures Buggy and Alvida's crews with White Out
Decides to chase the Straw Hats into the Grand Line
quotes: If you can beat me, you can go to the Grand Line!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro's encounter with Tashigi continues to trouble him due to her resemblance to Kuina, but he remains focused on his dream of becoming the world's greatest swordsman.
keyActions: Defeats Tashigi in a sword duel
Declares his dream during the vow ceremony
quotes: I'm going to be the world's greatest swordsman!

characterSpotlights.development: The entire crew comes together for the iconic vow ceremony, solidifying their bonds and individual motivations as they enter the Grand Line together.
keyActions: Each member escapes from various threats in Loguetown
Perform the Grand Line vow ceremony together

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the escape sequence with more action scenes and character moments compared to the manga's more condensed version.
The vow ceremony scene is expanded in the anime with more emotional buildup and individual character focus.

trivia.fact: This episode concludes the Loguetown Arc and marks the end of the East Blue Saga, one of the most significant transition points in One Piece.
Dragon's first active intervention in this episode creates one of the earliest major mysteries in One Piece that wouldn't be fully explained for many years.
The Grand Line vow ceremony is one of the most iconic and beloved scenes in One Piece, often cited by fans as a defining moment for the series.
This episode aired on January 10, 2001, and was remastered for a special edition broadcast on March 30, 2013.
The green wind phenomenon sparked years of fan theories about Dragon's Devil Fruit powers, with many speculating he has wind or weather-based abilities.
Smoker's voice actor in the Japanese version, Ginzo Matsuo, voiced the character from Episodes 48-79 before being replaced by Mahito Ohba from Episode 94 onward.
